column4: I have an external RAID 10 array hooked up to my computer via USB, should I add that to fstab and if so, should I just use defaults for the options?????
usb raid device, doesn't sound like a good idea
why, it works great.
is it a hardware raid device ?
yes, hardware raid
does it auto mount when you plug it in ?
it does, but it might not always be turned on when the computer boots.
then leave it out of fstab
incorrect
don't put it in fstab though
1.) you are not using software raid 2.) you already have a raid device
it's important if you are going to follow guides that they apply to your system
i have two raid arrays setup.  One software, one hardware.
so please don't include it in /etc/fstab
if it an external device you should not include it in /etc/fstab
software RAID in using SATA ports on my mobo.  Hardware RAID is external enclosure via USB.
in what way ?
just to send an email if mdadm reports an error.
that's nothing to do with hotmail
can i use it to send my hotmail account an email?  how do i configure it for that?
postfix is just an mta - you need a client to send the mail
mdadm uses the mail command to send mail
so how do i configure that?
mail is just the client, you need to configure an mta such as postfix, or a remote smtp relay (such as your ISP's)
